laws.title: Microfinance Law No. 141 of 2014
laws.description: Regulates non-banking microfinance activities in Egypt.

articles.text: Microfinance activity requires a license from the Financial Regulatory Authority (FRA). Only joint-stock companies or NGOs with special authorization may practice.
The minimum issued capital for microfinance companies shall not be less than 15 million EGP (as amended).

laws.title: FRA Decision No. 173 of 2014 (Executive Regulations)
laws.description: Executive regulations detailing operational requirements for microfinance.

articles.text: Maximum microfinance loan size shall not exceed 220,000 EGP (as amended by Decision 14/2021).
Companies must transparently disclose effective interest rates and all administrative fees to clients before contract signing.

laws.title: FRA Decision No. 139 of 2023 (Governance)
laws.description: Regulates governance structures, board composition, and required committees.

articles.text: The Board of Directors must include at least one Independent Non-Executive Director (INED) for every three members.
Establishment of an Audit Committee is mandatory, chaired by a Non-Executive Director.
Establishment of a Risk Management Committee is mandatory to oversee enterprise risk appetite and framework.
The company must appoint a dedicated Compliance Officer reporting administratively to CEO and functionally to the Audit Committee/Board.

laws.title: FRA Decision No. 140 (Solvency & Risk)
laws.description: Determines capital adequacy, leverage ratios, and provisioning requirements.

articles.text: Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) must be maintained at minimum 12% of risk-weighted assets.
Provisioning: 0% for current, 5% for 1-30 days past due, 20% for 31-60, 50% for 61-90, 100% for >90 days.

laws.title: Egyptian Labor Law No. 12 of 2003
laws.description: Governs employer-employee relationships, contracts, leaves, and termination.

articles.text: Annual Leave: 21 days min, increasing to 30 days after 10 years of service or age 50.
Disciplinary Sanctions: Employers must have an approved list of sanctions. No penalty strictly allowed without investigation.
Overtime: 35% premium for day overtime, 70% for night overtime.

laws.title: Social Insurance Law No. 148 of 2019
laws.description: Governs social security contributions and pensions.

articles.text: Mandatory subscription for all employees. Contributions calculated on total wage up to the ceiling.

laws.title: Data Protection Law No. 151 of 2020
laws.description: Regulates the collection, processing, and transfer of personal data.

articles.text: Prohibition of processing personal data without explicit consent of the data subject.
Data Subject Rights: Right to access, rectify, and erase personal data.
Cross-border data transfer requires a license and adequate protection level in the recipient country.

laws.title: FRA Digital Lending Regulations (Decision 14/2021)
laws.description: Regulates fintech and digital lending apps.

articles.text: Digital lending platforms must use secure authentication (2FA) and E-KYC procedures approved by FRA.
Cybersecurity Audit: Mandatory annual penetration testing and vulnerability assessment for digital platforms.
Electronic Contracts: Digital loan agreements signed via E-Signature have full legal validity.

laws.title: E-Signature Law No. 15 of 2004
laws.description: Grants legal validity to electronic signatures and digital documents.

articles.text: Electronic signatures have the same evidential weight as physical signatures if they meet ITIDA technical standards.

laws.title: Income Tax Law No. 91 of 2005
laws.description: Regulates corporate income tax and payroll taxes.

articles.text: Corporate Tax Rate: 22.5% on net taxable profits.
Withholding Tax: Applicable on services provided by non-residents.
